catalogue_raissonne: Saunier 529 ii/ii with letters (only a few examples exist before letters)
description: man in profile with short pointed beard wearing black hat, glasses, dark jacket and checked pants, painting at an easel; man with donkey and kneeling woman with baby look over man's shoulder
inscription:
Signature, Date and Inscription

LLC, in the print: [Ed. / SAGOT. / PARIS. 1913.]; see Signed
provenance: [Frederick Mulder Old Master & Modern Prints, London, until 1985; sold in November for RTO, to Harry Drake]; Harry Drake, St. Paul (1985-d. 2012; bequeathed to MIA)
signed: LLC, in the print: [A L]; LLC, in pencil: [A Lepere  à Sagot]; see Inscription
title: The Donkey (to Edmond Sagot)
